page.description: When they are initially added to a component most buttons are somewhat bland. Changing the text and images on a button control, however, is easy.

section.description: For an illustration of styling options follow the guide below or watch [this video].

step.description: In the UX Builder on the UX Controls page open the 'Other Controls' menu. Click on the [Button] option to add a button control to the component.

Highlight the button control in the controls tree. In the properties list, in the Button Properties section, set the 'Advanced button control type' property dropdown to 'Button', 'Hyperlink', or 'Image'.
step.note: Selecting Image here means that the button will only be the image. As such, the button will have no border around it.

step.description: View the 'Button Appearance' section of the properties list. The property settings in this section will change depending on the advanced button control type selected.

section.title: Specifying an Image
section.description: You can use system images, imported images, svg images, and css images on a button control.

section.title: Adding Different Images for Different Events
Button Layout
section.description: If you select 'Button' from the 'Advanced button control type' property dropdown, then you can add both an image and text to the button. You can also add just an image or some text. The placement of the image and text on the button can be specified using the 'Button layout' property. Selecting the 'Image only' option here is different from selecting 'Image' in the 'Advanced button control type' property. The 'Image only' setting here will show only an image but this image will usually have an automatic border placed around it.
